newsitem.title: USA: Boston Chicken named in class action suit.
newsitem.headline: Boston Chicken named in class action suit.

text.p: Lawyers said Wednesday they filed a class action suit against Boston Chicken Inc in the U.S. District Court for the District of Colorado.

The complaint alleges Boston Chicken and its officers, directors and underwriters inflated the company's stock by concealing operating losses of stores run by Boston Chicken area developers; improperly reporting certain franchise fees as revenues; and making positive comments about the company's growth prospects, a statement said.
The lawsuit, filed by Weinstein Kitchenoff Scarlato & Goldman Ltd, follows a similar class action suit against Boston Chicken filed in the Colorado court June 24.
A Boston Chicken spokeswoman said the complaints are groundless and only "intended to make lawyers rich."
She declined to elaborate on the suit's allegations other than saying the company would defend itself vigorously.

The latest class action suit is filed on behalf of investors who bought Boston Chicken stock, liquid yield option notes notes and covertible debentures between February 6 1995 and May 28 1997, the lawyers'statement said.
The company's stock closed at 13-1/2 Wednesday afternoon, down 5/16
